type-conversion-intro_key2: **Note : Remember to run all the `code` examples and see them. Only by trying them will you be able to learn.**
type-conversion-intro_key4: In the previous sections, we understood that there are different types of data types in `Python`. Some of the types we have read about are :
type-conversion-intro_key6: Some examples are given below. Read them carefully.
type-conversion-intro_key7: We can convert our data from one `type` to another `data type` in `python`. This will come in very handy in the future because we will often have data in one type and we will have to convert to another type. In `Python` we can do these `type `conversions`` -
type-conversion-intro_key8:
1.`Float to `String``
2.`Float to `Integer``
3.`Integer to `String``
4.`Integer to `Float``
5.`String to `Float``
6.`String to `Integer``
type-conversion-intro_key10: Now let us see how to convert to `Integer`. `Type cast 12` to `Python` `Integer` and store 12.
type-conversion-intro_key11: `Python` does not know how to extract `integers` from `12houses`.
type-conversion-intro_key12: `Python` tries to convert `String` to `Integer` but throws an `error` if it is even a bit confusing. Ex :- `Python` cannot convert `12.2`, and `12houses` to `integer` but can do the same for `12`.
type-conversion-intro_key13: `Python` does not know how to extract `integers` from `12`
type-conversion-intro_key15: Converts any `float` to `Python` `integer` by removing its decimal part.
type-conversion-intro_key16: Now we will learn to `typecast` in `FLOAT`. This is similar to `typecasting` to `Integer`. See it yourself.
type-conversion-intro_key17: `Python` does not know how to extract `Float` from `12houses`.
type-conversion-intro_key19: `Python` simply adds the decimal point when we convert `INTEGER` to `FLOAT`.
type-conversion-intro_key20: Look carefully here that `Python` adds `.0` to the last.  Try converting a `Float` 12.2 to `Integer` in `Python`. Try and understand what is happening.
